Experience: [['PhD Student in Clinical Neurosciences', 'University of Cambridge', 'Sep 2020 - Present ¬∑ 1 yr 9 mos', 'Cambridge, Angleterre, Royaume-Uni'], ["Master's thesis", 'Harvard Medical School', 'Jul 2019 - Sep 2020 ¬∑ 1 yr 3 mos', 'Boston, USA', "Neuroregeneration Research Institute. Dr. Ole Isacson & Dr. Penelope Hallett. At McLean Hospital. Results were published as: Brekk OR, Korecka JA, Crapart CC, et al. Upregulating Œ≤-hexosaminidase activity in rodents prevents Œ±-synuclein lipid associations and protects dopaminergic neurons from Œ±-synuclein-mediated neurotoxicity. Acta Neuropathol Commun. 2020;8(1):127. Published 2020 Aug 6. doi:10.1186/s40478-020-01004-6 Abstract Sandhoff disease (SD) is a lysosomal storage disease, caused by loss of Œ≤-hexosaminidase (HEX) activity resulting in the accumulation of ganglioside GM2. There are shared features between SD and Parkinson's disease (PD). Œ±-synuclein (aSYN) inclusions, the diagnostic hallmark sign of PD, are frequently found in the brain in SD patients and HEX knockout mice, and HEX activity is reduced in the substantia nigra in PD. In this study, we biochemically demonstrate that HEX deficiency in mice causes formation of high-molecular weight (HMW) aSYN and ubiquitin in the brain. As expected from HEX enzymatic function requirements, overexpression in vivo of HEXA and B combined, but not either of the subunits expressed alone, increased HEX activity as evidenced by histochemical assays. Biochemically, such HEX gene expression resulted in increased conversion of GM2 to its breakdown product GM3. In a neurodegenerative model of overexpression of aSYN in rats, increasing HEX activity by AAV6 gene transfer in the substantia nigra reduced aSYN embedding in lipid compartments and rescued dopaminergic neurons from degeneration. Overall, these data are consistent with a paradigm shift where lipid abnormalities are central to or preceding protein changes typically associated with PD. Keywords: Lipid binding; Neuroprotection; Parkinson‚Äôs disease; Sandhoff disease; Œ±-Synuclein; Œ≤-Hexosaminidase.", 'Upregulating Œ≤-hexosaminidase activity in rodents prevents Œ±-synuclein lipid associations and protects dopaminergic neurons from Œ±-synuclein-mediated neurotoxicity', 'NEUROREGENERATION INSTITUTE'], ['Engineering internship', "L'Or√©al", 'Feb 2019 - Jun 2019 ¬∑ 5 mos', 'Paris, France', '‚ÄúDevelopment of ex-vivo studies for cosmetic device‚Äù - Determined the optimal electrical parameters and protocol to improve the transdermal delivery of active molecules by electroporation with cosmetic devices (tolerance, efficiency); - Led the set-up of the laboratory (tools, protocols); - Engineered required tools to practice electroporation on biological tissues (3D-printed applicators, new electrode design) - Strengthened project management, communication and decision-making skills'], ['Semester research project', 'Ecole polytechnique f√©d√©rale de Lausanne', 'Sep 2018 - Dec 2018 ¬∑ 4 mos', 'R√©gion de Lausanne, Suisse', '‚ÄúEpigenetic mechanisms affecting neuroprotection against Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease‚Äù.
